PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

Content: "! <image:225>

【錯誤】網傳緬甸7.9級地震？滿目瘡痍的多張照片？早於緬甸地震災情前出現
====================================

2025年04月02日

**編按：《客新聞》與《MyGoPen》合作反詐騙，將提供「事實查核」、「詐騙破解」等相關新聞訊息，本篇文章由《MyGoPen》提供，若疑似遭到詐騙，仍有疑問可撥打「165」反詐騙專線。**

### 你可以先知道：

網傳照片其實是影片截圖，早在 2025 年 3 月 20 就出現在網路上，和緬甸地震無關。

網傳「緬甸7.9級地震，滿目瘡痍，一片廢墟。由於震央在人口稠密的曼德勒，預估傷亡人數至少在3萬以上。如果加上失蹤人口，恐怕會超過七、八萬。」的訊息和多張照片。經查證，傳言照片其實是影片的截圖，而相同影片至少在 2025 年 3 月 20 就在 Facebook、TikTok 上流傳，相關貼文稱是加薩地區的畫面，但查無國際媒體有報導此影片，背景不明，只能確定和 3 月 28 日發生的緬甸地震無關。

[! <image:226>](https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgzHhUDbB4m5opTn75PUHDZ1U9Ih7ctr0oA44FRyPZRrntaQ4Tt1bBp_GpEvL2q0QGtokyOO5687cR6gyQeQjkqtfwsuRRYoww3co4zRjsDW3fjqGI2KtUH8Sn6ChcxQryJPbRT8EYsb5nyfygESjwnWX4x_V04o_3QXRVh5zILGwam0z0a5rIgxI8gAVU/s1600/my-photo.jpg)

網傳緬甸 7.9 級地震，滿目瘡痍，一片廢墟的多張照片？
----------------------------

原始謠傳版本：

> 缅甸7.9级地震，满目疮痍，一片废墟。由于震中在人口稠密的曼德勒，预估伤亡人数至少在3万以上。如果加上失踪人口，恐怕会超过七八万。

主要在社群平台流傳這些圖片：  

[![](https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh0OuXgmpw6W-P_fKFyJXP9YDrk6GZllMGtBBllrm9cgAtjCyhujxZkaSEo7nTUTwai-pwUaEMR_EzrY3KskDO1ls4b9zLO63vewX-TNUsdEUF8UZYPfijyMjsRaEHh-AbL4RHGJHqP-NCeQ7hR6aacGHvFHppn02otH71oPtsKqsX0SNuMx5wKr3_Pp7Q/s1600/image (1).png)](https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh0OuXgmpw6W-P_fKFyJXP9YDrk6GZllMGtBBllrm9cgAtjCyhujxZkaSEo7nTUTwai-pwUaEMR_EzrY3KskDO1ls4b9zLO63vewX-TNUsdEUF8UZYPfijyMjsRaEHh-AbL4RHGJHqP-NCeQ7hR6aacGHvFHppn02otH71oPtsKqsX0SNuMx5wKr3_Pp7Q/s1600/image (1).png)

查證解釋：

> ### 網傳圖片的原始來源與事件為何？
> 
> （一）透過影片反搜工具 InVID 分析網傳影片的關鍵畫面後進行搜尋，初步先查找到這其實是影片截圖的畫面，並**至少在 2025 年 3 月 20 日就已經在 [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/arifulislamnan017/videos/517680894441504/?__cft__%5B0%5D=AZXyTZ8FQGwcl-1g_M1VuPI_LT755fLyjJr7_JN6BirG_QztngCIimJSRSi5xKWJNRKJ4mtl3ncQC-Tbz1cAAQItlf34erS5Net-hftBq-SZ-a4MXjVbe383J95F4-t3A1-SCyliaPa7PDFqS09XSRKpFLL8rDJI-Rl8cr7ykwjBTiRYgj1J-oFYRcVILTEVFB4Q32dBdkvJZojQHuV9DVTh&__tn__=%2CO%2CP-R)
> 、[TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@farid21512/video/7483881123974499602)
>  等社群上流傳，貼文中均表示這是加薩地區**。
> 
> [! <image:228>](https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEguz0lgr_r3wtPqXRDL9aJFw2-XFOSHO7YHtG8DPi87Mzxh27ub9xCsFnx0LdYuNF3TcDJ2tI96G3PlObVbLtlx6gOFEBvn8_RpGK5hOQWQIg3TgbaP6QYnyPYWU9mwNoTUBIjKGkvUnEmfAn7Rak3phaAxluI-aZc5_M9C5Q4t56nHnnhcx_bkmfiaa_Y/s1600/image1-side.png)
> 
> （二）查核記者實際以關鍵字搜尋國際通訊社及媒體的相關新聞，卻沒有在加薩的報導中看到此影片，其背景來源不明，無法確認就是加薩當地的畫面；但可以確認此影片和 2025 年 3 月 28 日緬甸發生的地震無關，因為其流傳時間早於緬甸地震。

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from 客新聞 (Hakka News) on April 2, 2025, addresses the claim that the image <image:2> shows the aftermath of a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025. The article states that the image is a screenshot from a video that was circulating on Facebook and TikTok as early as March 20, 2025, and was falsely claimed to be from the Gaza region. The article concludes that the image is unrelated to the Myanmar earthquake. <image:225>, <image:226>, <image:228>.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

# Search Result

Content: "廣告

閱讀全文

MyGoPen

2025年4月2日 上午7:05

網傳「緬甸7.9級地震，滿目瘡痍，一片廢墟。由於震央在人口稠密的曼德勒，預估傷亡人數至少在3萬以上。如果加上失蹤人口，恐怕會超過七、八萬。」的訊息和多張照片。經查證，傳言照片其實是影片的截圖，而相同影片至少在 2025 年 3 月 20 就在 Facebook、TikTok 上流傳，相關貼文稱是加薩地區的畫面，但查無國際媒體有報導此影片，背景不明，只能確定和 3 月 28 日發生的緬甸地震無關。

 <image:253>

  
網傳緬甸 7.9 級地震，滿目瘡痍，一片廢墟的多張照片？  
  
原始謠傳版本：  

缅甸7.9级地震，满目疮痍，一片废墟。由于震中在人口稠密的曼德勒，预估伤亡人数至少在3万以上。如果加上失踪人口，恐怕会超过七八万。

  
主要在社群平台流傳這些圖片：  

 <image:254>

  
查證解釋：  

  
網傳圖片的原始來源與事件為何？  
  
（一）透過影片反搜工具 InVID 分析網傳影片的關鍵畫面後進行搜尋，初步先查找到這其實是影片截圖的畫面，並**至少在 2025 年 3 月 20 日就已經在 [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/arifulislamnan017/videos/517680894441504/?__cft__[0]=AZXyTZ8FQGwcl-1g_M1VuPI_LT755fLyjJr7_JN6BirG_QztngCIimJSRSi5xKWJNRKJ4mtl3ncQC-Tbz1cAAQItlf34erS5Net-hftBq-SZ-a4MXjVbe383J95F4-t3A1-SCyliaPa7PDFqS09XSRKpFLL8rDJI-Rl8cr7ykwjBTiRYgj1J-oFYRcVILTEVFB4Q32dBdkvJZojQHuV9DVTh&__tn__=%2CO%2CP-R)
、[TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@farid21512/video/7483881123974499602)
 等社群上流傳，貼文中均表示這是加薩地區**。  

 <image:255>

  
（二）查核記者實際以關鍵字搜尋國際通訊社及媒體的相關新聞，卻沒有在加薩的報導中看到此影片，其背景來源不明，無法確認就是加薩當地的畫面；但可以確認此影片和 2025 年 3 月 28 日緬甸發生的地震無關，因為其流傳時間早於緬甸地震。

    #### [暴風圈擴大再擴大！薇帕颱風今夜發威　全台降雨時程一次看](https://tw.news.yahoo.com/%E6%9A%B4%E9%A2%A8%E5%9C%88%E6%93%B4%E5%A4%A7%E5%86%8D%E6%93%B4%E5%A4%A7-%E8%96%87%E5%B8%95%E9%A2%B1%E9%A2%A8%E4%BB%8A%E5%A4%9C%E7%99%BC%E5%A8%81-%E5%85%A8%E5%8F%B0%E9%99%8D%E9%9B%A8%E6%99%82%E7%A8%8B-%E6%AC%A1%E7%9C%8B-091506800.html)
    
    \[Newtalk新聞\] 根據氣象署今(18)日下午發布的最新颱風動態，民眾切勿因白天的間歇風雨而掉以輕心，因為薇帕颱風的影響將在今晚起急遽增強，全台都將迎來一波由弱轉強的風雨過程。氣象署特別警告，從今晚到整個週末，將是這波颱風影響最劇烈的時期，東半部及恆春半島有豪雨發生機率，花東山區更有大豪雨以上等級的強降雨威脅，提醒民眾務必嚴加戒備，週末期間應避免所有海邊及高山活動。 這波雨勢的增強趨勢，從定量降水預報圖可看出明顯的時序變化。今日白天，雨區主要集中在東半部及南部山區；然而，關鍵的轉變將從今晚8時開始，直到明日清晨，迎風面的東半部地區雨勢將猛烈增強，降雨預測圖上顯示的顏色將轉為代表致災性豪雨的紅色與紫色等級。 明日白天，颱風影響將達到最高峰，猛烈的雨勢將持續灌爆整個東台灣，雨區更會擴大，南部及大台北地區都可能出現局部大雨。這場降雨預計將持續影響至明日深夜，提醒民眾必須做好長時間應對致災性降雨的準備。 除了逐步升級的雨勢，強風與長浪的威脅也同步增強。根據風場預測及陸上強風特報，從今晚開始，台灣各沿海地區及離島的風力將明顯轉強，東半部沿海更有機會出現4至5米高的大浪。氣象署已針對基隆北海岸

    #### [週末出門注意了！颱風恐帶來豐沛水氣　「這2地區」恐降豪雨](https://tw.news.yahoo.com/%E9%80%B1%E6%9C%AB%E5%87%BA%E9%96%80%E6%B3%A8%E6%84%8F%E4%BA%86-%E9%A2%B1%E9%A2%A8%E6%81%90%E5%B8%B6%E4%BE%86%E8%B1%90%E6%B2%9B%E6%B0%B4%E6%B0%A3-%E6%9D%B1%E9%83%A8-%E5%8D%97%E9%83%A8%E5%8F%AF%E8%83%BD%E9%99%8D%E8%B1%AA%E9%9B%A8-085142111.html)

    隨著華爾街迎來新一輪獲利浪潮，市場關注關稅政策、經濟數據與聯準會動向。美股集體收高，那斯達克與標普500指數同步改寫歷史新高，反映資金信心回溫。道瓊指數上漲229.71點，標普500指數漲0.54％、那斯達克漲0.75％、費半漲0.73％。科技五大巨頭走勢不一，微軟、亞馬遜走高，蘋果、Meta小跌；輝達、博通等半導體股同樣走強，台積電ADR勁揚3.38%。亞股今日漲跌互見，日股、韓股微幅走弱，港股強漲326點，上證指數走升0.5％。 台股方面，今（18）日受台積電(2330)法說利多激勵，加權指數開高震盪，終場收漲269.85點報23,383.13點，成交量3,694.08億元，周線連四紅，單周累計上漲632點。台積電(2330)收漲2.11％報1,155元，更有外資調高目標價至1,800元，聯發科(2454)收1,410元漲1.44％，鴻海(2317)完成填息，廣達(2382)同步收高。在台積電董事長魏哲家一句「人形機器人市場未來商機可望大於電動車10倍」，機器人概念股強勢領漲，和椿(6215)、昆盈(2365)、正崴(2392)攻上漲停，多檔概念股表現亮眼。矽晶圓族群台勝科(3532)大漲逾7%，合晶(6182)、中美晶(5483)漲勢跟進。傳產龍頭台塑(1301)收39.35元，盤中逼近40元大關，台化(1326)、台塑化(6505)、南亞(1303)同樣收高，資金回流傳產板塊。

    #### [準颱薇帕「得雙風助威」體積龐大！氣象粉專點3地恐有強風](https://tw.news.yahoo.com/%E6%BA%96%E9%A2%B1%E8%96%87%E5%B8%95-%E5%BE%97%E9%9B%99%E9%A2%A8%E5%8A%A9%E5%A8%81-%E9%AB%94%E7%A9%8D%E9%BE%90%E5%A4%A7-%E6%B0%A3%E8%B1%A1%E7%B2%89%E5%B0%88%E9%BB%9E3%E5%9C%B0%E6%81%90%E6%9C%89%E5%BC%B7%E9%A2%A8-115700525.html)
    
    薇帕颱風成形中！今（17）日中央氣象署表示，熱帶性低氣壓TD09（準颱薇帕），有機會在今晚增強為颱風，雖然登陸台灣機率不高，但要小心外圍環流影響；氣象粉專「台灣颱風論壇｜天氣特急」則指出，有西南季風、跨赤道氣流支持，雖整合速度慢，但準颱薇帕體積相當龐大，外圍強風區廣，通過巴士海峽或呂宋島時，北部、東部、南部要留意較強風勢。

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Yahoo News, published on April 2, 2025, states that the image in the claim is a screenshot from a video that circulated on Facebook and TikTok as early as March 20, 2025, and was claimed to be from the Gaza region. The search result confirms that the image is unrelated to the Myanmar earthquake of March 28, 2025. <image:253>, <image:254>, <image:255>.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

![（求真）一堆满目疮痍场景照，非缅甸地震！](https://cdn.sinchew.com.my/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/efbc88e6b182e79c9fefbc89e4b880e5a086e6bba1e79baee796aee7978de59cbae699afe785a7efbc8ce99d9ee7bc85e794b8e59cb0e99c87efbc81.png)

社交媒体流传这些图片，声称是在缅甸第二大城曼德勒的惨状。（图取自Mygopen.com）

（八打灵再也4日讯）缅甸发生[地震](https://www.sinchew.com.my/tag/地震)
后，网上发布一些照片显示震后满目疮痍的场景，经过查证后，这些照片于3月20日已在脸书和其他社交媒体出现，相信是属于[加沙](https://www.sinchew.com.my/tag/加沙/)
地区。

缅甸于3月28日发生7.9级地震后，社交媒体上出现一些照片，显示震央曼德勒的情况，贴文指：“缅甸7.9级地震，满目疮痍，一片废墟。由于震中在人口稠密的曼德勒，预估伤亡人数至少在3万以上。如果加上失踪人口，恐怕会超过七八万。”

ADVERTISEMENT

![（求真）一堆满目疮痍场景照，非缅甸地震！](https://cdn.sinchew.com.my/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/efbc88e6b182e79c9fefbc89e4b880e5a086e6bba1e79baee796aee7978de59cbae699afe785a7efbc8ce99d9ee7bc85e794b8e59cb0e99c87efbc81-1.png)

经过查证后证实，这些照片早在3月20日出现，虽然无法确定是否在加沙地区，但很肯定不是在缅甸发生。（图取自Mygopen.com）

台湾打假新闻平台Mygopen进行查证，透过影片反搜工具InVID分析网传影片的关键画面，初步查找到这其实是影片截图的画面，并至少在今年3月20日就已经在脸书、抖音等社群上流传，贴文中均表示是加沙地区。

此外，该平台也以关键字搜寻国际通讯社及媒体的相关新闻，却没有在加沙的报道中看到此影片，其背景来源不明，无法确认就是加沙当地的画面。

但可以确认此影片和3月28日缅甸发生的地震无关，因为其流传时间早于缅甸地震。

次转发

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

## Web Sources
**Reverse Search Result** The exact image was found in the following sources:

From [Source](https://hakkanews.tw/2025/04/02/errora-79-magnitude/): Found exact image on website with title: 【錯誤】網傳緬甸7.9級地震？滿目瘡痍的多張照片？早於 ... - 客新聞
Content: The search result from 客新聞 (Hakka News) on April 2, 2025, addresses the claim that the image <image:2> shows the aftermath of a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025. The article states that the image is a screenshot from a video that was circulating on Facebook and TikTok as early as March 20, 2025, and was falsely claimed to be from the Gaza region. The article concludes that the image is unrelated to the Myanmar earthquake. <image:225>, <image:226>, <image:228>.


From [Source](https://tw.news.yahoo.com/%E9%8C%AF%E8%AA%A4-%E7%B6%B2%E5%82%B3%E7%B7%AC%E7%94%B87-9%E7%B4%9A%E5%9C%B0%E9%9C%87-%E6%BB%BF%E7%9B%AE%E7%98%A1%E7%97%8D%E7%9A%84%E5%A4%9A%E5%BC%B5%E7%85%A7%E7%89%87-%E6%97%A9%E6%96%BC%E7%B7%AC%E7%94%B8%E5%9C%B0%E9%9C%87%E7%81%BD%E6%83%85%E5%89%8D%E5%87%BA%E7%8F%BE-050500537.html): Found exact image on website with title: 【錯誤】網傳緬甸7.9級地震？滿目瘡痍的多張照片？早於緬甸地震 ...
Content: The search result from Yahoo News, published on April 2, 2025, states that the image in the claim is a screenshot from a video that circulated on Facebook and TikTok as early as March 20, 2025, and was claimed to be from the Gaza region. The search result confirms that the image is unrelated to the Myanmar earthquake of March 28, 2025. <image:253>, <image:254>, <image:255>.


From [Source](https://www.sinchew.com.my/news/20250404/nation/6425552): Found exact image on website with title: 网上不实照片真多加沙旧图变缅地震照- 国内 - 星洲日报
Content: The article from Sin Chew Daily, published on April 4, 2025, addresses the spread of a photo online, which was falsely claimed to be from the Myanmar earthquake. The article states that the image <image:2> is actually from the Gaza region and was circulating on social media as early as March 20, 2025, before the Myanmar earthquake on March 28, 2025.

In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:2>

### Evidence from `image_search`
The Britannica website ([https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025](https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025)) discusses the Myanmar earthquake of 2025 and provides an image of the ruins. <image:7850> EurekAlert.org contains an image of a damaged building with rescue workers. <image:7851>

The New York Times published an article on March 28, 2025, about an earthquake in Myanmar. <image:7852>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image search results confirm the existence of a 2025 earthquake in Myanmar. The Britannica website discusses the event and provides an image of the ruins. The New York Times also published an article about the earthquake on March 28, 2025. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image in the claim depicts the ruins of the 2025 Myanmar earthquake.

I need to compare the image in the claim with the images from the search results to verify the claim.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:2>

### Evidence from `image_search`
The Britannica website ([https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025](https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025)) discusses the Myanmar earthquake of 2025 and provides an image of the ruins. <image:7850> EurekAlert.org contains an image of a damaged building with rescue workers. <image:7851>

The New York Times published an article on March 28, 2025, about an earthquake in Myanmar. <image:7852>


## Elaboration
The image search results confirm the existence of a 2025 earthquake in Myanmar. The Britannica website discusses the event and provides an image of the ruins. The New York Times also published an article about the earthquake on March 28, 2025. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image in the claim depicts the ruins of the 2025 Myanmar earthquake.

I need to compare the image in the claim with the images from the search results to verify the claim.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image search results confirm the existence of a 2025 earthquake in Myanmar. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image in the claim depicts the ruins of the 2025 Myanmar earthquake. The image in the claim needs to be compared with the images from the search results to verify the claim.

`not enough information`
_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:2>

### Evidence from `image_search`
The Britannica website ([https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025](https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025)) discusses the Myanmar earthquake of 2025 and provides an image of the ruins. <image:7850> EurekAlert.org contains an image of a damaged building with rescue workers. <image:7851>

The New York Times published an article on March 28, 2025, about an earthquake in Myanmar. <image:7852>


## Elaboration
The image search results confirm the existence of a 2025 earthquake in Myanmar. The Britannica website discusses the event and provides an image of the ruins. The New York Times also published an article about the earthquake on March 28, 2025. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image in the claim depicts the ruins of the 2025 Myanmar earthquake.

I need to compare the image in the claim with the images from the search results to verify the claim.


# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
image_search("Myanmar earthquake ruins")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record

The New York Times published an article on March 28, 2025, about an earthquake in Myanmar. <image:7852>


## Elaboration
The image search results confirm the existence of a 2025 earthquake in Myanmar. The Britannica website discusses the event and provides an image of the ruins. The New York Times also published an article about the earthquake on March 28, 2025. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image in the claim depicts the ruins of the 2025 Myanmar earthquake.

# Instructions

* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:2>

### Evidence from `image_search`
The Britannica website ([https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025](https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025)) discusses the Myanmar earthquake of 2025 and provides an image of the ruins. <image:7850> EurekAlert.org contains an image of a damaged building with rescue workers. <image:7851>

The New York Times published an article on March 28, 2025, about an earthquake in Myanmar. <image:7852>


## Elaboration
The image search results confirm the existence of a 2025 earthquake in Myanmar. The Britannica website discusses the event and provides an image of the ruins. The New York Times also published an article about the earthquake on March 28, 2025. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image in the claim depicts the ruins of the 2025 Myanmar earthquake.

I need to compare the image in the claim with the images from the search results to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("Myanmar earthquake ruins")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
The search results from artnews.com ([https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/monumental-ruins-emerge-following-massive-myanmar-earthquake-1234738471/](https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/monumental-ruins-emerge-following-massive-myanmar-earthquake-1234738471/)) show an image of ruins after the Myanmar earthquake <image:2911>. Archaeology.org ([https://archaeology.org/news/2025/04/15/earthquake-in-myanmar-exposes-ancient-royal-structure/](https://archaeology.org/news/2025/04/15/earthquake-in-myanmar-exposes-ancient-royal-structure/)) discusses the earthquake and shows an image of an ancient royal structure <image:2912>. National Geographic ([https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/article/myanmar-earthquake-religious-cultural-sites](https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/article/myanmar-earthquake-religious-cultural-sites)) shows an image of the ruins of a religious site <image:2913>.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image search results show different images of the ruins after the Myanmar earthquake. However, none of the images match the image in the claim. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

The Britannica website ([https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025](https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025)) discusses the Myanmar earthquake of 2025 and provides an image of the ruins. <image:7850> EurekAlert.org contains an image of a damaged building with rescue workers. <image:7851>

The New York Times published an article on March 28, 2025, about an earthquake in Myanmar. <image:7852>


## Elaboration
The image search results confirm the existence of a 2025 earthquake in Myanmar. The Britannica website discusses the event and provides an image of the ruins. The New York Times also published an article about the earthquake on March 28, 2025. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image in the claim depicts the ruins of the 2025 Myanmar earthquake.

I need to compare the image in the claim with the images from the search results to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("Myanmar earthquake ruins")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
The search results from artnews.com ([https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/monumental-ruins-emerge-following-massive-myanmar-earthquake-1234738471/](https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/monumental-ruins-emerge-following-massive-myanmar-earthquake-1234738471/)) show an image of ruins after the Myanmar earthquake <image:2911>. Archaeology.org ([https://archaeology.org/news/2025/04/15/earthquake-in-myanmar-exposes-ancient-royal-structure/](https://archaeology.org/news/2025/04/15/earthquake-in-myanmar-exposes-ancient-royal-structure/)) discusses the earthquake and shows an image of an ancient royal structure <image:2912>. National Geographic ([https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/article/myanmar-earthquake-religious-cultural-sites](https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/article/myanmar-earthquake-religious-cultural-sites)) shows an image of the ruins of a religious site <image:2913>.


## Elaboration
The image search results show different images of the ruins after the Myanmar earthquake. However, none of the images match the image in the claim. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:2>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'China': 0.77, 'Bangladesh': 0.05, 'Indonesia': 0.02, 'Japan': 0.02, 'Palestine': 0.02, 'Philippines': 0.02, 'Taiwan': 0.02, 'Jordan': 0.01, 'Nigeria': 0.01, 'Pakistan': 0.01}

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The geolocation results suggest that the image was most likely taken in China, not Myanmar. Therefore, the claim is not supported by the evidence.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```

image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:2> This image shows the ruins after a 7.9-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar on March 28, 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:2>)
image_search("earthquake Myanmar 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:2>

### Evidence from `image_search`
The Britannica website ([https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025](https://www.britannica.com/event/Myanmar-earthquake-of-2025)) discusses the Myanmar earthquake of 2025 and provides an image of the ruins. <image:7850> EurekAlert.org contains an image of a damaged building with rescue workers. <image:7851>

The New York Times published an article on March 28, 2025, about an earthquake in Myanmar. <image:7852>


## Elaboration
The image search results confirm the existence of a 2025 earthquake in Myanmar. The Britannica website discusses the event and provides an image of the ruins. The New York Times also published an article about the earthquake on March 28, 2025. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image in the claim depicts the ruins of the 2025 Myanmar earthquake.

I need to compare the image in the claim with the images from the search results to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("Myanmar earthquake ruins")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
The search results from artnews.com ([https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/monumental-ruins-emerge-following-massive-myanmar-earthquake-1234738471/](https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/monumental-ruins-emerge-following-massive-myanmar-earthquake-1234738471/)) show an image of ruins after the Myanmar earthquake <image:2911>. Archaeology.org ([https://archaeology.org/news/2025/04/15/earthquake-in-myanmar-exposes-ancient-royal-structure/](https://archaeology.org/news/2025/04/15/earthquake-in-myanmar-exposes-ancient-royal-structure/)) discusses the earthquake and shows an image of an ancient royal structure <image:2912>. National Geographic ([https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/article/myanmar-earthquake-religious-cultural-sites](https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/article/myanmar-earthquake-religious-cultural-sites)) shows an image of the ruins of a religious site <image:2913>.


## Elaboration
The image search results show different images of the ruins after the Myanmar earthquake. However, none of the images match the image in the claim. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:2>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'China': 0.77, 'Bangladesh': 0.05, 'Indonesia': 0.02, 'Japan': 0.02, 'Palestine': 0.02, 'Philippines': 0.02, 'Taiwan': 0.02, 'Jordan': 0.01, 'Nigeria': 0.01, 'Pakistan': 0.01}

## Elaboration
The geolocation results suggest that the image was most likely taken in China, not Myanmar. Therefore, the claim is not supported by the evidence.


## Final Judgement
The image search and geolocation results do not support the claim. The image is not of the Myanmar earthquake ruins, and the geolocation suggests the image was most likely taken in China.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. While a 7.9-magnitude earthquake did occur in Myanmar on March 28, 2025, the image provided does not depict the ruins from that event. Image searches and geolocation analysis suggest the image was likely taken in China.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:8> This image shows Israel launching several waves of revengeful attacks on Iranian military targets on October 26, 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:8>)
geolocate(<image:8>)
image_search("Israel attacks Iranian military targets October 26 2024")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

![Head of the Southern Syrian Tribal Gathering in a statement to Al Jazeera: The situation is very difficult, more than 2,000 tribesmen are held captive by the Druze. We appeal to the tribes not to attack anyone, the goal of our operation is to free our sons who are being held hostage by the al-Hijri group. Sheikh Hikmat al-Hijri bears responsibility for what happened in Sweida. We call on the tribesmen not to commit any violations against our Druze brothers. We blame the government for leaving the tribes in Sweida under siege. We were surprised by the agreement that led to the withdrawal of government forces from Sweida](https://syria.liveuamap.com/pics/2025/07/18/22774120_0.jpg)10 hour ago

[As-Suwayda Governorate, Syria](https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2025/18-july-10-head-of-the-southern-syrian-tribal-gathering-in "Head of the Southern Syrian Tribal Gathering in a statement to Al Jazeera: The situation is very difficult, more than 2,000 tribesmen are held captive by the Druze. We appeal to the tribes not to attack anyone, the goal of our operation is to free our sons who are being held hostage by the al-Hijri group. Sheikh Hikmat al-Hijri bears responsibility for what happened in Sweida. We call on the tribesmen not to commit any violations against our Druze brothers. We blame the government for leaving the tribes in Sweida under siege. We were surprised by the agreement that led to the withdrawal of government forces from Sweida")

Head of the Southern Syrian Tribal Gathering in a statement to Al Jazeera: The situation is very difficult, more than 2,000 tribesmen are held captive by the Druze. We appeal to the tribes not to attack anyone, the goal of our operation is to free our sons who are being held hostage by the al-Hijri group. Sheikh Hikmat al-Hijri bears responsibility for what happened in Sweida. We call on the tribesmen not to commit any violations against our Druze brothers. We blame the government for leaving the tribes in Sweida under siege. We were surprised by the agreement that led to the withdrawal of government forces from Sweida

We blame the government for leaving the tribes in Sweida under siege. We were surprised by the agreement that led to the withdrawal of government forces from Sweida](https://syria.liveuamap.com/pics/2025/07/18/22774120_0.jpg)

18 July 2025[As-Suwayda Governorate Tribal forces take control of Tal al-Hadid, overlooking the city of Suweida from the West](https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2025/18-july-19-tribal-forces-take-control-of-tal-alhadid-overlooking "event located at As-Suwayda Governorate")
[As Suwayda,As-Suwayda Governorate Sweida: Arab tribal forces in Sweida control the industrial area and approach the municipal stadium in Sweida amid violent clashes with the the Hijri militias](https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2025/18-july-18-sweida-arab-tribal-forces-in-sweida-control-the "event located at As Suwayda,As-Suwayda Governorate")
[As-Suwayda Governorate, Syria Arab tribal forces captured Najran village in the Suwayda countryside from militias](https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2025/18-july-18-arab-tribal-forces-captured-najran-village-in "event located at As-Suwayda Governorate, Syria")

[As Suwayda,As-Suwayda Governorate Violent clashes between tribal forces and Al-Hijri militias at the entrance to the city of Sweida](https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2025/18-july-17-violent-clashes-between-tribal-forces-and-alhijri "event located at As Suwayda,As-Suwayda Governorate")

On another front, control was taken of the village of Kafr Rima al-Lahf.](https://syria.liveuamap.com/en/2025/18-july-17-tribal-forces-control-several-villages-in-the "event located at As-Suwayda Governorate, Syria")

Areas control

Government & pro-government forces: Assad, Russia, Iran

Rebels: FSA, moderate rebels(many groups: Ahrar Al Sham, Jaish al Islam etc), more radical groups like Hayat Tahrir Al-Sham HTS(ex Al-Nusra)

Islamic State

Kurds: YPG, PKK, Peshmerga, other

Golan Heights - controlled by Israel

FSA groups and Turkish troops in Northern Syria

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is from Syria Live Map and contains a picture of an explosion over a city at night <image:645>. The picture is from October 22, 2024, and is described as "a picture of the raid that targeted the Al-Laylaki area a short while ago". The website also contains news about the conflict in Syria, including events from July 18, 2025. The website also has a map of the conflict with different icons and areas of control.
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:8> This image shows Israel launching several waves of revengeful attacks on Iranian military targets on October 26, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:8>)
geolocate(<image:8>)
image_search("Israel attacks Iranian military targets October 26 2024")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:8> This image shows Israel launching several waves of revengeful attacks on Iranian military targets on October 26, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:8>)
geolocate(<image:8>)
image_search("Israel attacks Iranian military targets October 26 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://harapandaily.com/2025/06/17/middle-east-on-the-brink-gaza-israel-iran/): Found exact image on website with title: Middle East on the brink: Gaza, Israel, Iran - Harapan Daily
Content: "

! <image:649>

The Middle East stands at a perilous crossroads today. The aggression of Israel against Gaza has reached unprecedented levels, with a magnitude of destruction that the world cannot ignore.

Backed tacitly—and at times openly—by the United States and many Western powers, Israel’s military campaign in Gaza has gone beyond the boundaries of defense, crossing into systemic devastation of civilian infrastructure, indiscriminate killings, and collective punishment of the Palestinian people.

These actions, justified under the pretext of security, echo the darker chapters of history where power was exercised without restraint and conscience.

**The Israeli Assault on Gaza: A Crisis of Humanity**

Since the renewed escalation in Gaza began, thousands of innocent civilians—many of them women and children—have been killed. Homes, hospitals, schools, and places of worship have been flattened.

Access to water, food, and medical aid is systematically obstructed, creating a humanitarian catastrophe of colossal proportions. The siege on Gaza has become a global symbol of suffering and injustice, where international laws and human rights conventions appear suspended in favor of military dominance.

The Israeli government, under Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and a coalition of ultra nationalists, has dismissed calls for ceasefire, deflected international investigations, and labeled every act of resistance as terrorism, while justifying its own excessive use of force as “defense.”

Yet, what is unfolding in Gaza is not just a military operation—it is a deliberate strategy of attrition, designed to break the Palestinian will and erase their claim to dignity, land, and nationhood.

Shockingly, despite global outrage, Benjamin Netanyahu has been formally accused by the International Criminal Court (ICC) for alleged war crimes committed during the Gaza operations. The very fact that such charges could be brought against a sitting head of government should prompt global action.

Yet, Netanyahu walks free—welcomed in Western capitals, unimpeded in his travels, treated with deference by media and political elites. Where is the international community’s commitment to justice? Who shields him from arrest and prosecution?

The answer is plain: a coalition of powerful nations, led by the United States and certain European allies, who selectively uphold international law when it suits their strategic interests. This duality corrodes the very foundations of global order.

**The Role of the United States and the West: Complicity Through Silence and Support**

It is no secret that the United States remains Israel’s most powerful ally, providing billions in military aid, advanced weapons systems, and unwavering political cover at international forums like the United Nations.

European countries, though more cautious in language, have largely refrained from decisive action. The so-called liberal democracies, which so often preach about human rights and international order, have failed the people of Gaza.

The silence of Western governments, or worse, their implicit support, sends a dangerous message: that some lives are worth more than others, and that military power justifies any action, no matter how barbaric. This hypocrisy not only undermines the credibility of the international system but also sows the seeds of long-term instability and global resentment.

**The Iranian Factor: A Strategic Counterbalance Emerges**

Amid this devastation, Iran has emerged as a key regional power capable of altering the balance. Despite years of sanctions, sabotage, and geopolitical isolation, Iran has built a formidable network of allied forces across the region—Hezbollah in Lebanon, various Iraqi militia groups, the Houthis in Yemen, and even influence among certain Syrian factions.

Its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) has grown into one of the most sophisticated non-NATO military forces in the world, with capabilities in drones, missiles, cyber warfare, and unconventional tactics.

Iran’s response to Israeli aggression has been measured but symbolically powerful. The April 2024 drone and missile operation targeting Israeli military installations was unprecedented, demonstrating both capability and intent.

While most of the drones were intercepted, the sheer scale and precision shocked Western and Israeli military planners. Iran, once thought to be only a shadow power, has shown it can act—and when it does, it shakes the entire region.

More importantly, Iran’s growing influence across the Muslim world is ideological as much as it is military. It presents itself as a resistance power, willing to stand up against Western hegemony and Israeli expansionism, echoing the spirit of its 1979 Islamic Revolution that overthrew the U.S.-backed Shah.

That revolution was not merely political—it was a deeply symbolic rejection of Western control over Muslim lands, a theme that resonates even more today as Palestinians bleed and the world watches.

**History Repeats: The West Should Remember Vietnam and the Shah**

The United States must recall its past mistakes. It was defeated in Vietnam despite possessing overwhelming military power. The Vietnamese people, driven by nationalism and resilience, made the cost of occupation unbearable.

Similarly, America’s alliance with the Shah of Iran crumbled when the Iranian people rose up, rejecting a regime seen as a puppet of U.S. interests. Today, the same forces of resistance and rebellion are stirring in the Middle East, driven by years of humiliation, occupation, and betrayal.

No amount of weapons, propaganda, or diplomatic maneuvering can extinguish a people’s desire for freedom and justice. If America continues on its current path—arming Israel, ignoring war crimes, and demonizing any form of resistance—it will not only lose moral credibility, but also geopolitical stability across a region critical to the world’s energy and security architecture.

**A Turning Point for the Middle East**

What we are witnessing now is not merely another round of violence. It is a reckoning. Israel’s unrestrained military campaign, with Western backing, is catalyzing a new realignment of forces. Iran and its allies may be viewed with suspicion by the West, but to many across the region, they represent strength in the face of imperial arrogance. This should be a moment of serious reflection for Western powers.

The people of Gaza deserve peace, dignity, and a future free from siege and war. The people of Israel deserve security, but not at the cost of another nation’s annihilation. And the world deserves a Middle East that is just, not merely stable for the sake of oil and arms.

The arc of history is long, but it bends toward justice—provided we do not look away when justice is being strangled in plain sight."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from Harapan Daily discusses the conflict in the Middle East, focusing on the Israeli assault on Gaza and the role of Iran. The article includes the image <image:649>. The article mentions an Iranian drone and missile operation targeting Israeli military installations in April 2024.

* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image (<image:8>) appears in articles discussing the conflict in the Middle East, specifically the Israeli assault on Gaza and the role of Iran. One source, Syria Live Map, uses the image to depict an explosion over a city at night, dated October 22, 2024, and describes it as a raid on the Al-Laylaki area. Another source, Harapan Daily, uses the image (<image:649>) in an article about the conflict, mentioning an Iranian drone and missile operation targeting Israeli military installations in April 2024. The image also appears on News Live - Oregon (<image:648>) and is described as "a picture of the raid that targeted the Al-Laylaki area a short while ago".

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-28-2024): 
Content: "
<image:7872>"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Institute for the Study of War and AEI's Critical Threats Project published a map showing confirmed IDF strikes in Iran as of October 28, 2024, at 2:00 PM ET. The IDF launched three waves of strikes targeting around 20 locations around Tehran and western Iran on October 25. <image:7872>

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:8> This image shows Israel launching several waves of revengeful attacks on Iranian military targets on October 26, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:8>)
geolocate(<image:8>)
image_search("Israel attacks Iranian military targets October 26 2024")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-28-2024): 
Content: The Institute for the Study of War and AEI's Critical Threats Project published a map showing confirmed IDF strikes in Iran as of October 28, 2024, at 2:00 PM ET. The IDF launched three waves of strikes targeting around 20 locations around Tehran and western Iran on October 25. <image:7872>


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/26/middleeast/israel-strikes-iran-explainer-intl-hnk): 
Content: CNN reports on Israeli strikes in Iran on October 26, 2024. <image:7873>


From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/26/condemnation-calls-for-restraint-world-reacts-to-israeli-strikes-on-iran): 
Content: Al Jazeera reports that Israel carried out overnight strikes on military targets in Iran on October 26, 2024. <image:7874>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Institute for the Study of War and AEI's Critical Threats Project published a map showing confirmed IDF strikes in Iran as of October 28, 2024, at 2:00 PM ET. The IDF launched three waves of strikes targeting around 20 locations around Tehran and western Iran on October 25. CNN reports on Israeli strikes in Iran on October 26, 2024. Al Jazeera reports that Israel carried out overnight strikes on military targets in Iran on October 26, 2024.

The sources are: [https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-28-2024](https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-28-2024), [https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/26/middleeast/israel-strikes-iran-explainer-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/26/middleeast/israel-strikes-iran-explainer-intl-hnk), and [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/26/condemnation-calls-for-restraint-world-reacts-to-israeli-strikes-on-iran](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/26/condemnation-calls-for-restraint-world-reacts-to-israeli-strikes-on-iran). <image:7872> <image:7873> <image:7874>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:8> This image shows Israel launching several waves of revengeful attacks on Iranian military targets on October 26, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:8>)
geolocate(<image:8>)
image_search("Israel attacks Iranian military targets October 26 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:8>) appears in articles discussing the conflict in the Middle East, specifically the Israeli assault on Gaza and the role of Iran. One source, Syria Live Map, uses the image to depict an explosion over a city at night, dated October 22, 2024, and describes it as a raid on the Al-Laylaki area. Another source, Harapan Daily, uses the image (<image:649>) in an article about the conflict, mentioning an Iranian drone and missile operation targeting Israeli military installations in April 2024. The image also appears on News Live - Oregon (<image:648>) and is described as "a picture of the raid that targeted the Al-Laylaki area a short while ago".


### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.4, 'Israel': 0.3, 'Bangladesh': 0.04, 'Taiwan': 0.04, 'Ukraine': 0.04, 'China': 0.02, 'Pakistan': 0.02, 'Bulgaria': 0.01, 'Jordan': 0.01, 'Malta': 0.01}

### Evidence from `image_search`
The Institute for the Study of War and AEI's Critical Threats Project published a map showing confirmed IDF strikes in Iran as of October 28, 2024, at 2:00 PM ET. The IDF launched three waves of strikes targeting around 20 locations around Tehran and western Iran on October 25. CNN reports on Israeli strikes in Iran on October 26, 2024. Al Jazeera reports that Israel carried out overnight strikes on military targets in Iran on October 26, 2024.

The sources are: [https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-28-2024](https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-28-2024), [https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/26/middleeast/israel-strikes-iran-explainer-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/26/middleeast/israel-strikes-iran-explainer-intl-hnk), and [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/26/condemnation-calls-for-restraint-world-reacts-to-israeli-strikes-on-iran](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/26/condemnation-calls-for-restraint-world-reacts-to-israeli-strikes-on-iran). <image:7872> <image:7873> <image:7874>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim that the image shows Israel launching attacks on Iranian military targets on October 26, 2024, is partially supported by the evidence. The image search results confirm that Israel did launch strikes on Iranian military targets on October 26, 2024. However, the reverse image search indicates that the image has been used in different contexts, including depicting events on October 22, 2024, and an Iranian drone and missile operation in April 2024. The geolocation data does not provide conclusive evidence about the image's origin.

Therefore, while the date of the attacks aligns with the claim, the image's provenance is uncertain. It is possible that the image is related to the events described in the claim, but further verification is needed to confirm its specific context.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.
